snippet: The Yankees’ shortstop Derek Jeter hit his fifth home run of the season and kept his average above .400.
abstract: New York Yankees defeat Kansas City Royals, 6-2. (M){
lead_paragraph: KANSAS CITY, Mo. -- If the injured Mariano Rivera needed any convincing that age need not be a deterrent in his return from a serious knee injury, Derek Jeter provided it on Friday night. Jeter, who will turn 38 on June 26, added two more hits, including a two-run homer, to his league-leading tally and scored two runs to help lead the Yankees to a 6-2 victory over the Kansas City Royals at Kauffman Stadium.

headline.main: Jeter's Homer Helps Yankees Upend Royals
